section.title: List of trademarked terms, their symbols, and their legal notices
section.para: This section, when viewed in a document, has been shared into that document as an included file, which may be derived from a release version. The master source of this data is in CommonContent\SharedContent\en_US\legal\trademarks.xml, and it should only be edited there, not in any released branch. This section is organized as a series of formalpara elements, one per trademarked term. The system ignores the para elements that precede the formalpara elements, so all instructions should go in the paragraphs at the beginning.
If we need legal review of a trademark issue, consult a Nokia trademark counsel. As of 5/28/15, the person to contact is David Bijon.

listitem.para:
For new terms:
Search the list to make sure the term, or one like it, does not already exist. The term might be commented out.
Insert new terms in alphabetical order. (Exception: All of the Nokia trademarks go at the END of this document.)

Add or edit the formalpara for the term. Each formalpara has the following content.
Follow this exact structure because this list, in addition to providing a reference, is used by the automated trademark features to determine which terms to mark with symbols, and to generate a list of trademark legal notices appropriate for a document.
Avoid remarks in the first two paras. If you want to include a remark on a term, include in a third, writeronly para of the formalpara.
The trademark term goes in the title of the formalpara.
For a term like Apache ActiveMQ, where the company name is listed first but is also a trademarked term, put just the second part, ActiveMQ, in the title. Then when trademarking terms in a document, mark it like this:<trademark>Apache</trademark> <trademark>ActiveMQ</trademark>This practice allows the system to put a trademark on each word at its first occurrence.
The first para in the formalpara should contain the type of symbol, selected from the following list; these are the valid values for a trademark tag's class attribute.
trade (for the standard TM symbol)
registered (for the (R) symbol)
service (for the service mark SM symbol)
copyright (for the (C) symbol) [HOWEVER, DO NOT USE THIS VALUE IN THIS FILE. Do not add entries to this file with copyright as the symbol type; we do not need those in our trademarks lists.]
The second para in the formalpara should contain the legal notice for the term.
If you need to insert an extra para element, for example to insert a remark, make sure it is AFTER the first two para elements, as those are pulled by the tools for data; since the system grabs them in order of occurrence, inserting one at the beginning causes errors.

note.para: The following items have been checked and are not trademarked: Rhino (a Mozilla product but not listed as a trademark).

About Apache trademarks and any company that has many trademarks: There is no need to list trademarks in the legal text if they are referenced in the company's name trademark. For example, Apache and the Apache feather logo are both listed under Apache; although the standard Apache text lists them for each and every Apache trademark like Apache ActiveMQ, we do not need to list them there because they will show up in the legal statement when you mark 'Apache' as a trademark.

About Oracle trademarks: The only Oracle trademark that needs symbols is Oracle itself. Oracle states this on their page about trademark usage. For this reason, you do not need to include a symbol for terms such as: Java, JAXB, JDK, JavaScript, JDBC, MySQL, Solaris, or WebLogic.

section.para: Apache ActiveMQ, ActiveMQ, and the Apache ActiveMQ project logo are trademarks of The Apache Software Foundation.

formalpara.title: Web
formalpara.para: MicroStrategy and MicroStrategy Web are registered trademarks or trademarks of MicroStrategy Incorporated.

formalpara.title: Web Services
formalpara.para: Doing this as 'Web Services' and not 'Amazon Web Services' b/c we already trademark Amazon separately.Amazon Web Services and the Powered by Amazon Web Services logo are trademarks of Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates in the United States and/or other countries.

formalpara.title: WebSphere
formalpara.para: IBM, MVS and WebSphere are trademarks of International Business Machines Corporation, registered in many jurisdictions worldwide.

formalpara.title: WhatsApp
formalpara.para: WhatsApp is a trademark owned by Facebook.

para.remark: 18 Oct 2016: Poornima added for CAL 2.0. (Taken from https://www.facebookbrand.com/trademarks)

formalpara.title: Wi-Fi
formalpara.para: Wi-Fi is a registered trademark of Wi-Fi Alliance.Taken from http://www.wi-fi.org/download.php?file=/sites/default/files/private/Wi-Fi_Alliance_Brand_Styleguide-201404.pdf

formalpara.title: WildFly
formalpara.para: WildFly is a registered trademark of Red Hat, Inc. in the U.S. and other countries. This is something of an inference, copied from JBoss copyright. No info on WildFly as a TM in WildFly docs, but TM websites show it as registered. Also note they show it as WILDFLY but WildFly material uses 'WildFly'. --Aaron DaMommio, 8/11/16

formalpara.title: Windows
formalpara.para: Windows is a trademark or a registered trademark of the Microsoft Corporation in the United States, other countries.

formalpara.title: Word
formalpara.para: Microsoft Word is a trademark or a registered trademark of the Microsoft Corporation in the United States, other countries.

formalpara.title: Xeon
formalpara.para: Intel and Xeon are trademarks of Intel Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.

formalpara.title: Xerces
formalpara.para: Apache Xerces, Xerces, Apache, the Apache feather logo, and the Apache Xerces logo are trademarks of The Apache Software Foundation.

formalpara.title: XML Commons
formalpara.para: xml-commons, Apache xml-commons and The Apache XML Project logos are trademarks of The Apache Software Foundation.

para.remark: 10 Aug 2015: changed the title to XML Commons as per http://www.apache.org/foundation/marks/list/

formalpara.title: XMLSchema
formalpara.para: XMLSchema, and Apache XMLSchema and The Apache XMLSchema Project logos are trademarks of The Apache Software Foundation.

formalpara.title: Zabbix
formalpara.para: Zabbix is a registered trademark of Zabbix LLC.

formalpara.title: ZooKeeper
formalpara.para: Apache ZooKeeper and ZooKeeper are trademarks of The Apache Software Foundation.
